subject: AI & Agents
title: Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations
description: A quick, practical guide to Reinforcement Learning for Recommendations.

hook.text: Most recommenders optimize for the next click. RL optimizes for the entire user session.

buildup.text: RL treats recommendation as a sequential decision problem: recommend, observe, adapt.

discovery.text: The agent learns a policy that maximizes long-term reward: engagement, diversity, or satisfaction.

twist.text: RL can discover that showing a 'boring but useful' item now leads to more engagement later.

climax.text: Challenges: credit assignment over long sessions, exploration vs exploitation, and reward design.

punchline.text: Don't just predict the next click. Optimize the journey.

quiz.question: What does RL optimize in recommendations?
options: Long-term user satisfaction over an entire session
